This vignette covers viewing list objects in the `ttdviewer` package.

## List object

Below we'll define a list with two `#TidyTuesday` datasets and store it in  `ttd2`:

```{r}
#| label: ttd2
ttd2 <- load_tt_data("Space Launches")
```

### custom_tree()

`custom_tree()` is a custom folder tree function made with `lobstr::tree()`:

```{r}
#| label: custom_tree
custom_tree <- function(x = as.list(), depth = 10L, length = 50L) {
  lobstr::tree(x,
    max_depth = depth,
    max_length = length,
    show_environments = FALSE,
    show_attributes = FALSE,
    hide_scalar_types = TRUE,
    class_printer = crayon::blue,
    remove_newlines = TRUE,
    val_printer = crayon::green
  )
}
```

```{r}
#| label: custom_tree-tdd2
#| comment: ""
custom_tree(x = ttd2)
```

### listviewerlite::listview()

The `listview()` from `listviewerlite` provides an HTML collapsible object:

```{r}
#| label: listviewerlite--listview-tdd2
listviewerlite::listview(x = ttd2)
```
